operation_mode.label: Operation Mode
operation_mode.comment: You can switch between the different environments, by selecting the corresponding operation mode.

test_mode.label: Test Mode
test_mode.comment: You can switch between the different test modes.

access_token.label: Authorization Bearer Token (Access Token)
access_token.comment: The Authorization Bearer Token is provided by PayUnity. Access token can be taken from the backend UI under Administration > Account data > Merchant / Channel Info only if you have specific administration rights.

user_id.label: User ID (Deprecated)
user_id.comment: The user ID is provided by PayUnity. This authentication method is deprecated, please use the 'Authorization Bearer Token' instead.

user_password.label: User Password (Deprecated)
user_password.comment: The password is provided by PayUnity. This authentication method is deprecated, please use the 'Authorization Bearer Token' instead.

transaction_id_schema.label: Merchant Transaction ID Schema
transaction_id_schema.comment: Here you can configure a schema for the merchantTransactionId parameter. The tag {id} will be replaced by a guaranteed unique id, which may be created using a combination of order and transaction ids. The tag {tid} will be replaced by the transaction id, and the tag {oid} will be replaced by the order id. This field should stay unique, we advise using {id}. The text will be cut at 255 characters.

descriptor_schema.label: Descriptor Schema
descriptor_schema.comment: Here you can configure a schema for the descriptor parameter. The tag {id} will be replaced by a guaranteed unique id, which may be created using a combination of order and transaction ids. The tag {tid} will be replaced by the transaction id, and the tag {oid} will be replaced by the order id. The text will be cut at 127 characters.

global_entity_id.label: Entity ID
global_entity_id.comment: You receive an Entity ID when you create your PayUnity account. The entity ID specified here will be taken, when no specific Entity ID is defined in the payment method settings.

custom_parameters.label: Custom Parameters
custom_parameters.comment: You can define custom parameters that are sent to the PSP with every request. Syntax: "customParameters[RISK_MID]=123123", one parameter per line.

webhook_secret_key.label: Webhook Secret Key
webhook_secret_key.comment: You can specify the secret key during the setup of the webhook.

cancel_existing_orders.label: Cancel pending orders when out of stock
cancel_existing_orders.comment: If a product is in stock only once and the payment of the customer ordering this product fails or is aborted, it won't be available until the order is canceled (see timeout option below). Enable this setting to cancel the customer's pending orders when he returns to the cart page and a product is not available anymore. Be careful though: If you enable this option, there is a chance that payments are made with the corresponding order being already canceled.

cancel_pending_orders.label: Timeout for pending orders
cancel_pending_orders.comment: Define the number of seconds after which orders with a pending payment will be cancelled automatically.

wait_for_success.label: Wait On Success Page
wait_for_success.comment: In some cases the transaction requires a few seconds until it is successfully authorized. When this option is enabled the user is hold until the transaction reach the final state. If this is not the case in 30 seconds a message is shown to the customer, which explains the situation.

logging_level.label: Logging Level
logging_level.comment: Messages of this or a higher level will be logged.

recurring.label: Recurring Payments
recurring.comment: If you would like to use recurring payments, you need our magento module "Customweb Subscription". For further information go to sellxed.com.

show_image.label: Show the payment image
show_image.comment: Show the payment image on the checkout page

show_payment_id.label: Show the payment id
show_payment_id.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

Currency.label: Currency
Currency.comment: Allowed currencies for this payment method

use_base_currency.label: Use base currency
use_base_currency.comment: Send amounts to PayUnity in base currency.

settlement.label: Invoice settlement
settlement.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status

invoice_send_email.label: Send invoice email
invoice_send_email.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

payment_methods.label: Payment Methods
payment_methods.comment: Define the payment methods, the customer can choose from. List them separated by a space.

channel_id.label: Entity ID
channel_id.comment: The Entity ID is a unique key for the identification of the unit which sends transactions into the system.

channel_conditions.label: Channel Conditions
channel_conditions.comment: Beside the default channel id a set of channel ids depending on the order total amount can be defined. Each line must contain a lower amount, an upper amount and the applicable channel id. The format is as follow 'lower amount;upper amount;channel id'. The following example shows a conrete on: '10.00;200.00;23413113213131231353' The upper boundaries are not included. If you leave this field empty or if a amount is outside any range the default channel id is applied. If multiple conditions match, the last one is taken.

channel_id_nothreed.label: Entity ID (MoTo)
channel_id_nothreed.comment: If this payment method should support recurring and moto transactions, you have to specify a second entity ID without 3d secure.

capturing.label: Capturing
capturing.comment: Should the amount be captured automatically after the order (direct) or should the amount only be reserved (deferred)? If instructed to do so you can also choose the risk based capturing. But please note that this feature can only be used if your account has the option activated. Contact your service provider for more information.

widget_style.label: COPYandPAY Style
widget_style.comment: Define the style to be used for the COPYandPAY payment form.

status_refusetopay.label: Order Status: Refused After Uncertain
status_refusetopay.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are refused after being in a uncertain state.

send_postal_state.label: Send Postal State
send_postal_state.comment: 3DSecure 2.0 expects the postal state of the customer's address to be in ISO 3166-2 format. Otherwise, the payment will be declined. If the shopping cart does not support this format for postal states, disable to send the postal state with the transaction.

status_authorized.label: Authorized Status
status_authorized.comment: This status is set, when the payment was successfull and it is authorized.

status_uncertain.label: Uncertain Status
status_uncertain.comment: You can specify the order status for new orders that have an uncertain authorisation status.

status_captured.label: Captured Status
status_captured.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are captured either directly after the order or manually in the backend.

authorizationMethod.label: Authorization Method
authorizationMethod.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.

alias_manager.label: Alias Manager
alias_manager.comment: The alias manager allows the customer to select from a credit card previously stored. The sensitive data is stored by PayUnity.

show_image.label: Show the payment image
show_image.comment: Show the payment image on the checkout page

show_payment_id.label: Show the payment id
show_payment_id.comment: Show the payment id in the order information

Currency.comment: Allowed currencies for this payment method

use_base_currency.comment: Send amounts to PayUnity in base currency.

widget_style.comment: Define the style to be used for the COPYandPAY payment form.

authorizationMethod.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.
